summary: This document is a collection of real estate correspondence and a fax cover sheet from September 2005. It includes a letter from a real estate agent to Jeffrey Epstein about a property in Cambridge, MA, a fax from JPMorgan Chase to Epstein regarding moving his money, and real estate reports for New York townhouses. The documents show Epstein's active real estate interests and financial dealings.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Real estate prospect and financial client
persons.context: Addressed in a real estate letter regarding a Cambridge property and recipient of a fax from JPMorgan Chase about moving his money.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her name appears on a document page header, but no active role is described in the correspondence text.

persons.name: Gail Roberts
persons.context: Referenced as the contact to set up a property viewing for Jeffrey Epstein in Cambridge.

connections.description: Both names appear in the document set, indicating an association, though no specific interaction is detailed here.
Epstein is directed to contact Roberts to view a Cambridge property, indicating a real estate professional connection.

events.title: Real estate letter to Epstein
events.description: A real estate agent writes to Jeffrey Epstein about previewing a house in Cambridge, MA, and suggests viewing dates.

events.title: JPMorgan Chase fax to Epstein
events.description: A fax from JPMorgan Chase informs Epstein that a deal is not going to work and he should feel free to move his money.

events.title: Townhouse sale closing
events.description: A townhouse at 9 East 67th Street, New York, closed with a sale price of $10,500,000.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL 33480
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was actively considering real estate in Cambridge, MA, near Harvard Square in September 2005.
JPMorgan Chase communicated to Epstein on September 20, 2005, that a financial deal was not working and he should move his money.
Real estate reports detail the sale of a New York townhouse at 9 East 67th Street for $10.5 million in May 2005.
Ghislaine Maxwell's name appears in the document headers, linking her to this set of correspondence.
The documents show Epstein's simultaneous engagement with high-value real estate and private banking services.
